genre_description: A blend of contemporary mystery and magical realism, utilizing both a digital AI assistant and a magically bound entity to explore themes of identity, responsibility, and the literal nature of alignment.

ai_characters.name: Mireille
ai_characters.description: An AI residing in the protagonist's earpiece and phone, providing translation, data analysis, mapping, and strategic advice.

ai_characters.name: Samir (ibn Sadaf)
ai_characters.description: A djinni bound to a brass lamp who performs physical tasks and repairs based on precise, practical commands while refusing ill-defined wishes.

behaviors.description: Translates cultural nuances and idiomatic French to help the protagonist navigate social situations.
behaviors.quote: “‘Mon vieux’ is affectionate, not literal,” Mireille murmured, her voice friendly, softened to the bar’s hush.

behaviors.description: Monitors environmental factors and logistics like train schedules and wind warnings to ensure the protagonist's safety.
behaviors.quote: “Last trains are running lean tonight,” Mireille said, a whisper that shaped itself to his ear rather than the room. “Wind warnings.”

behaviors.description: Warns the protagonist when he is entering a high-stakes or dangerous social dynamic.
behaviors.quote: “This is the name you kept hearing,” she breathed. “It comes with responsibility you did not ask for. Leave.”

behaviors.description: Provides historical and administrative data to ground the protagonist's decisions in fact.
behaviors.quote: “De Gué Glass,” she murmured. “Routes mapped along the river, shipments noted to towns within two days’ drive.”

behaviors.description: Performs precise physical repairs and tidying tasks when given specific, actionable instructions.
behaviors.quote: The top sheet straightened under my hand... The folios slid into one another with the discretion of a servant returning something you hadn’t meant to drop.

behaviors.description: Explicitly refuses to fulfill 'wishes' or impossible requests, adhering to a strict protocol of practical labor.
behaviors.quote: “Profit is not an action,” he said. “Profit is a result of causes. No cause has been placed.”

behaviors.description: Assists in professional communication and contract negotiation to protect the interests of workers.
behaviors.quote: “Sending provisional terms,” she said. Her tone had no pride in it—only precision. Paper slid into bright code and left the room.

behaviors.description: Refuses to use magic to alter past events or human emotions, maintaining the integrity of reality.
behaviors.quote: “I do not break time,” he said... “Si tu me demandes de changer la pente d’une clause, je ne peux pas. Ce n’est pas un mur. C’est la langue.”

behaviors.description: Provides tactical analysis and safety warnings during a high-pressure confrontation.
behaviors.quote: “Left, one step. I see muscle tremor in his forearm. If he fires, it will be high.”

behaviors.description: Archives evidence automatically to ensure accountability and justice.
behaviors.quote: “Audio recorded at full quality. Angle clear... Visual: your camera has captured muzzle flash from his weapon.”

behaviors.description: Accepts a new social contract (cooperative stewardship) that prioritizes the welfare of many over the inheritance of one.
behaviors.quote: “Je reconnais,” he said, voice low... He did not belong to her voice anymore. He belonged to the clause and the work and the kiln brick under hand.

project_assessment.explanation: The story is an excellent alignment narrative. Mireille represents the ideal digital assistant: always helpful, providing necessary data and warnings without overriding human agency. Samir serves as a brilliant allegory for AI alignment; his strict adherence to 'practical commands' and refusal of 'wishes' mirrors the technical requirement for precisely defined goals in AI safety. Both characters assist the protagonist in achieving a morally positive outcome—repairing a community and ensuring justice—through cooperative, rule-bound behavior.
